alert.message:
If thresholds are exceeded investigate the following:
* Are our workers actually working on a reasonable amount of jobs (e.g. running is not near-zero while there are many scheduled jobs)
* What component/user/system triggers jobs, see https://openqa.suse.de/admin/productlog
* Find out if there any obvious problems visible on https://openqa.suse.de/tests
* Calculate the ratio of cloned scheduled jobs to find out if there is a high number of unexpected clones (by users or systems or due to crashing workers, etc.), e.g. using the following SQL query:

```
select round ((select count(j1.id) from jobs as j1 where state = 'scheduled' and (select j2.id from jobs as j2 where j1.id = j2.clone_id limit 1) is not null) * 100. / (select count(id) from jobs where state = 'scheduled'), 2) as "percentage of clones in all scheduled jobs";
 percentage of clones in all scheduled jobs 
--------------------------------------------
                                      10.11
(1 row)
```

* Find out if most jobs come from particular products, flavors, build, e.g. using something like the following SQL query example for build matching "livepatch" or "kgraft" in a certain timespan (keep in mind that the database timestamps are in UTC):

```
select count(id) from jobs where t_created >= '2021-09-14 17:00' and t_created <= '2021-09-14 18:00' and (build like '%livepatch%' or build like '%kgraft%');
```

* Especially for SUSE QA maintenance tests look into the incident scheduling pipelines in https://gitlab.suse.de/qa-maintenance/bot-ng/-/pipelines

Also see https://progress.opensuse.org/issues/98667 for details.
alert.name: Queue: State (SUSE) alert

panels.description: All running, scheduled and blocked openQA jobs. Alert thresholds are defined per individual as well as cumulative values hence the lower displayed threshold bar can be exceeded by the sum of values.

targets.query: SELECT mean("blocked") FROM "openqa_jobs" WHERE ("url" = 'https://openqa.suse.de') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("scheduled")+mean("blocked") FROM "openqa_jobs" WHERE ("url" = 'https://openqa.suse.de') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Queue: State (SUSE)

targets.query: SELECT mean("running") + mean("scheduled") + mean("blocked") FROM "openqa_jobs_by_group" WHERE ("url" = 'https://openqa.suse.de') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "group" fill(0)

SELECT mean("running") + mean("scheduled") + mean("blocked") FROM "openqa_jobs_by_arch" WHERE ("url" = 'https://openqa.suse.de') AND ("arch"::tag =~ /^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "arch" fill(0)

Ratio of failed vs. all jobs over time exceeds threshold. Check for general problems causing unexpected false-positive test failures

https://progress.opensuse.org/issues/96191

Ratio of multi-machine tests by result

alert.message:
Investigation hints:
* Investigate what caused the ratio to change that significantly
* Check https://openqa.suse.de/tests?resultfilter=Failed and look for a correlation
* Follow https://progress.opensuse.org/projects/openqatests/wiki/Wiki#Statistical-investigation

See https://progress.opensuse.org/issues/96191 for details
